dt: used chiefly as a direction in music

et: borrowed from Italian, from the phrase {it}ad agio,{/it} literally, "at ease," from {it}ad, a{/it} "to, at" (going back to Latin {it}ad{/it}) + {it}agio{/it} "ease, convenience," borrowed from Old French {it}aise, eise{/it} {ma}{mat|at:1|}, {mat|ease:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: at a slow tempo —used chiefly as a direction in music

dt: {bc}a musical composition or movement in adagio tempo
{bc}a ballet duet by a man and woman or a mixed trio displaying difficult feats of balance, lifting, or spinning

shortdef: a musical composition or movement in adagio tempo
a ballet duet by a man and woman or a mixed trio displaying difficult feats of balance, lifting, or spinning
